pull_request.title: Fix gzclient startup crash with ogre 1.9

pullrequest.title: Fix gzclient startup crash with ogre 1.9

content.raw: So I just compiled ogre1.9 devel branch (not 1.9.0 release) and it seems with that gazebo2.2 is running. Maybe you can give it a try from my formulae. You need to `brew install ogre1.9 --devel` and before that `brew unlink ogre`. The rebuild my updated `gazebo2 formula` (or build it manually from source which you probably have checked out anyway).
content.html: So I just compiled ogre1.9 devel branch (not 1.9.0 release) and it seems with that gazebo2.2 is running. Maybe you can give it a try from my formulae. You need to brew install ogre1.9 --devel and before that brew unlink ogre. The rebuild my updated gazebo2 formula (or build it manually from source which you probably have checked out anyway).

pull_request.title: Fix gzclient startup crash with ogre 1.9

pullrequest.title: Fix gzclient startup crash with ogre 1.9

content.raw:
So gazebo 2.2 with this patch, but built against ogre 1.7.4 seems to work. There are some notorious errors on the command line like
```
2014-07-18 03:22:09.441 gzclient[69516:507] invalid drawable
Error [Param.cc:181] Unable to set value [1,0471975511965976] for key[horizontal_fov]
Error [Param.cc:181] Unable to set value [0,100000001] for key[near]
```
and it segfaults upon exit, but it runs.
content.html:
So gazebo 2.2 with this patch, but built against ogre 1.7.4 seems to work. There are some notorious errors on the command line like

2014-07-18 03:22:09.441 gzclient[69516:507] invalid drawable
Error [Param.cc:181] Unable to set value [1,0471975511965976] for key[horizontal_fov]
Error [Param.cc:181] Unable to set value [0,100000001] for key[near]

and it segfaults upon exit, but it runs.

pull_request.title: Fix gzclient startup crash with ogre 1.9

pullrequest.title: Fix gzclient startup crash with ogre 1.9

content.raw:
Yes I have updated that formula to 1.9 with some tinkering.

I thought the client crashed with the last message being `invalid drawbale`, but in fact it is just that the main window closes immediately after start. But it keeps running and I can for example open the topic visualization window.
content.html:
Yes I have updated that formula to 1.9 with some tinkering.

I thought the client crashed with the last message being invalid drawbale, but in fact it is just that the main window closes immediately after start. But it keeps running and I can for example open the topic visualization window.

content.raw:
I always see the `invalid drawable` console messages on osx; they're most likely a red herring.

How did you build ogre for osx? I've tinkered with ogre 1.9 in the [ogre formula in our homebrew tap](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/blob/master/ogre.rb#L8), but I haven't tried it recently.
content.html:
I always see the invalid drawable console messages on osx; they're most likely a red herring.

How did you build ogre for osx? I've tinkered with ogre 1.9 in the ogre formula in our homebrew tap, but I haven't tried it recently.

content.raw: Hm... gzclient seems to immediately crash with 'invalid drawable' error, but I'm not sure if this is directly related to Ogre 1.9 and/or this patch. Anyway, without this patch it refuses to even build with Ogre 1.9. I'm on OS X 10.9.
content.html: Hm... gzclient seems to immediately crash with 'invalid drawable' error, but I'm not sure if this is directly related to Ogre 1.9 and/or this patch. Anyway, without this patch it refuses to even build with Ogre 1.9. I'm on OS X 10.9.

pull_request.title: Fix gzclient startup crash with ogre 1.9

update.description:
issue #996

it was segfaulting due to null materials so the solution is to set submeshes to use the Gazebo/White material as default.

There are still some problems with ogre 1.9, one of them is that shadows are not working.
update.title: Fix gzclient startup crash with ogre 1.9
